p: Essential oils are natural oils extracted from different parts of the plant. They are complex mixtures of low molecular weight compounds that can be obtained by different means of extraction such as steam distillation, hydro-distillation, or solvent extraction. They are usually stored in oil ducts, resin ducts, glands, or trichomes of the plants. Essential oils have been used as raw materials in many fields, including perfumes, cosmetics, and foods. Moreover, interest in the use of essential oils in the treatment of many health-related conditions has been steadily increasing over the past years [ 15, 33].
